item.title: First Friday Mass
item.description:
Mass @ 5:30PM @ Epiphany Catholic Church

Meal (cheese pizza) to follow, along with an AMA with Father Jack.

Learn more about the First Friday devotion here: https://www.fisheaters.com/sh.html

item.title: Pickleball
item.description: Come play pickleball with us at Rollingbrook Park. Paddles provided if you don’t have one.

item.title: Outing at Rader Family Farms
item.description: Join us for an outing at Rader Family Farms. We’ll have mass at Historic St. Pat’s at 5PM, and then head over to Rader’s at 6:30PM!

item.title: Urban Pilgrimage
item.description: Join us as we walk the streets from St. Mary’s, to HSP/HT, to Epiphany, to pray in conjunction with the National Eucharistic Congress on July 20th. Meet at Epiphany at 1PM to carpool over to St. Mary’s.

item.title: SONshine @ Comlara
item.description:
Come take a hike and enjoy the outdoors with other young adults of the faith!

Comlara Park (13001 Recreation Area Dr, Hudson, IL)

Cookout to follow in the evening. Feel free to bring games, instruments, etc.

Q’s? Contact: blonocatholic@gmail.com

item.title: Rosary Making Workshop
item.description: Learn to make knotted rosaries! We are meeting at Emerson Park at 6PM on Friday, May 17th. In case of poor weather, we will be meeting at a neighboring house: 710 E Wood St, Bloomington IL.

item.title: Rosary Walk

item.title: A Treasured Love Story
item.description: Kerri Elson leads a small group that strives to grow in the virtues of faith, hope and charity through using a combination of spiritual reading, Scripture study and group discussion. We pursue genuine community and friendships through our meetings, activities and prayers. We welcome young adult women from all backgrounds and support each other on our faith journeys! Currently we are reading through A Treasured Love Story: Lessons we can learn from St. Therese of Lisieux (taught by Venerable FJ Sheen).

item.title: Chris Dunning
item.description:
Leader

Chris grew up as a cradle Catholic in Naperville, Illinois. His parents involved him with his parish from a young age going to mass and praying together every night. It wasn’t until college, that he really grew close to the Catholic church. While attending Illinois State University, he regularly attended the John Paul II Catholic Newman Center where he deepened his relationship with Christ through bible studies, eucharistic adoration, and retreats. After college, he continued to help with a local youth ministry and was involved in many different young adult groups. Along with leading BloNo Catholic, he is a Firefighter/Paramedic for the City of Bloomington and works 3 other EMS jobs.

item.title: Katie Van Horn
item.description:
Communications Coordinator

Katie Van Horn is the Communications Coordinator. She works on BloNo Catholic’s advertising through social media and parish outreach, as well as note keeping.

item.title: Lauren & Lizzy
item.description: Lauren Booth & Lizzy O’Brien lead a laid back group studying and striving to build community. They meet every Tuesday 6:30pm-8:00pm at Laurens house. This small group is open to any young adult women and current has an age range of 23-36.

item.title: Niko Miranda
item.description:
Treasurer

Moved to Bloomington in April 2023 from Northwest Suburbs of Chicago. 25 years old, Hispanic, likes playing piano, found God in college. Currently working in manufacturing industry as a program manager since 2021.

item.title: Rediscovering the Saints
item.description: Chris Dunning is leading a book study of Rediscovering the Saints by Matthew Kelly, for young men.

item.title: Resources
item.description:
“Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and you shall find: knock, and it shall be opened to you.” - Matthew 7:7

  • Find a Church Near You
  • Daily Mass Readings

  • Examination of Conscience
  • Vatican Website

item.title: Rick Kuduk
item.description: Spiritual Coordinator

item.title: Thaddeus Hughes
item.description:
Media Designer

Thad grew up and lives on a farm around Funks Grove, became a mechatronic engineer, and reinvigorated his faith when he joined a Melkite Catholic parish in New Hampshire. He enjoys making everything - cars to kombucha to icons, singing, and running a publication called Machinae Ex Deo, exploring how faith informs technological development.

item.title: Wrestling With God
item.description: We are reading through some of the minor books of the Old Testament, beginning with Esther, every Thursday Evening at Epiphany. Contact Nick Reichmuth for more info.
